sources.name: Florida Building Code 2025
sources.reference: FBC 2025 - Site work and grading requirements
sources.note: As of July 1, 2025, residential construction permits have state-imposed timelines affecting site work approvals

sources.name: Florida Contractor Licensing
sources.reference: F.S. 489.113 - Certified contractors may perform clearing, grubbing, grading, and excavation
sources.note: Site work requires certified building contractors or certified residential contractors

sources.name: South Florida Water Management District
sources.reference: SFWMD - Environmental compliance for grading and land disturbance
sources.note: Contact SFWMD directly for current 2025 requirements on permits and environmental compliance

sources.name: Miami-Dade County DERM
sources.reference: Department of Environmental Resources Management - Stormwater management requirements
sources.note: Contact Miami-Dade County DERM for local stormwater management and grading permit requirements

sources.name: Miami-Dade RER
sources.reference: Regulatory and Environmental Resources - Local grading and fill permits
sources.note: Contact RER for current 2025 requirements on erosion control and surface water regulations

keyPoints: Florida Building Code governs site work, clearing, grading, and excavation
2025 permitting changes include state-imposed timelines for residential construction
Certified contractors required for site work projects
Local regulations vary by county (Miami-Dade, Broward, Palm Beach, Monroe)
Environmental compliance required through SFWMD and county agencies
